actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-919, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 5021. All points of order against the motions printed in the joint statement of the managers on the conference report to dispose of Senate amendments numbered 6, 20, 54, 82, 100, 107, 109, and 143 for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 7 of rule XVI shall be waived. All points of order against a motion offered by Mr. Smith of Iowa printed in the report accompanying this resolution to dispose of Senate amendment no. 83 for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 7 of rule XVI shall be waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 201.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against motions to dispose of amendments reported in disagreement from the conference on the bill (H.R. 5021) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against motions to dispose of certain Senate amendments printed in the joint statement of the managers on the conference report on H.R. 5021 (Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies appropriations).
